data.text: The Target app is my go-to for convenient shopping on-the-go. It's user-friendly interface and intuitive navigation make browsing and purchasing a breeze. The Target Circle rewards program offers great discounts and savings. However, occasional glitches and slow loading times can be frustrating. Improvements in app stability and performance would elevate the user experience. Despite these issues, it remains an essential tool for managing my shopping needs.

Search feature is absolutely broken. It doesn't give you what you are searching for half the time, and when it does, the first half of the results are usually unrelated garbage. The filters don't work, and it will show you what you filtered out anyways. It won't show you search results often times if you aren't specific enough. For example I searched for t shirts, and was told no results found. I searched for mens t shirts, and it suddenly found 800 results.

Would do 0 stars but not an option. App itself is great for finding items in store, but god forbid you try to order anything for delivery. Twice I've tried and had original orders canceled and replaced with iPad. Both times I've had to call both Target and shipt telling them I never authorized replacement or purchase of iPad. Oh and the hours of phone time where it's not Targets fault that I got charged for an item I didn't authorize because shipt driver can decide to change order and charge me.

Update: Okay, now I can't even select a store or enter a zip code without an error. Jrjfjfkfkf. The app was great but has increasingly gotten worse with each new update. I rely heavily on this app daily. Yesterday, I took it to the store and had to force close the app every single time I scanned an item, just because it would freeze up. The bugs have significantly increased how long I'm at the store. It's frustrating to use now, unfortunately, and the app is primarily how I used to shop.

A great responsive app. From checking out prices. To online ordering. Make certain to "clip" special offers as if they were coupons. Which essentially they are but Target calls them "offers". Clip in the app before adding to cart so you get the discounts and special pricing. And look/check your "Target Circle" offers. Just because it shows you that you have these offers does not mean you automatically get the offers. You must "click the offers you want to use. Skip the in-store theft prevention

Very useful and feature rich app, but lacks notifications channel. Android has this beautiful feature to set different notifications preferences for different types of notifications from same app. I'd want my "ready for pickup" notification to be loud whereas deals & offers in silent and can catch up later. But Target app doesn't provide this capability.

I have had better luck with logout issues in the recent versions of the app. I can even use the app wallet without fear of it asking me to log again in the moddle of the checkout line before it will show the barcode. Probably this is down to inprovements in the biometric login interface. Still pretty challenging to browse deals and add coupons (though that is probably because most deals just give you a gift card instead of a discount).

Still bugged out. Can't view any reviews. Items that should show up in the search don't. I had to have someone send me a link because the app refused to show a particular item even after searching for it verbatim. It's like the app is hiding items from you, which is really weird. Almost renders the app useless but the website isn't any better.

The app works great. I have used the drive-up delivery service at two different stores without issue. Groceries are usually ready within an hour. There is no minimum purchase however the cheapest items in stock are never available for pickup service. Not a big problem for items priced within a few cents. But quite annoying for things like hotdog buns. Cheapest $1.39 but available for pickup $2.39. This can add up quickly! And unable to see receipts within the app.

This app makes it too confusing when ordering online. More than once, I have begun a curbside pickup order only to learn that only 1/2 my items are curbside when I check out. Additionally, Circle offers do not always apply when ordering online. They need to simplify the interface. Updated 1/21/24. The app continues to be more and more difficult to use. I continually struggle to find target circle. While shopping in-store, I get offers for ordering online. #SimpleIsBetter

Omgoodness, I like the app to order curbside pick up and paying my credit card... but for the last few days I can't access the app at all. It keeps saying something went wrong on their end try again. Beyond frustrated. I agree with all the other 1 to 2 star comments below. It's hard to get an accurate search, u think it's curbside and end up getting it shipped. You don't get the right items on your search . You can do better Target

Searches do not give you accurate search results! If you put in the filter you want to pick your things up from the store, you still get search results that include, and sometimes mostly are for online only offers! In addition, when you specify a specific size and gender you're searching for, it still gives you everything, regardless if you have put in filters and sort parameters! So you end up going through NEEDLESS, UNWANTED search results! TARGET, FIX THIS! IT IS ANNOYING!

Many of the reveiwers here don't seem to understand the difference between rating Target as a retailer, and rating this product, which is an App. Hands down, this is the BEST retail app out there for preplanning a trip to Target, picking up or returning an order, checking pricing and availablily of items across the chain, locating items in-store, finding great deals, etc. With this app, you can be in an out the door, having purchased a basketfull of items, in no time (line-length pending).

Hi there's no way to leave feedback in the app. But the verify account popup page doesn't seem to work. Even when the password is correct. Only way around it is to reset password. Really tricky at checkout. Would be great to put a 4 digit pin in there or use a thumbprint if it's that big of a security concern. Current setup doesn't work for me on a pixel 7.

If you'd like to check out the WORST FUNCTIONING APP IN EXISTENCE, look no further. Whoever job it is to make this app work properly should be fired. Whatever program you use to send th3 code to sign into your account ( even after saying it's my device and to NOT send codes) they won't send them. You have to depend on someone or somthing at Target to use this app. It's Infuriating to the point that I don't even want the damn card anymore

Mostly unusable on Pixel 8, Pixel 6, and Pixel 6 pro running latest firmware and app version (and has been for a while). I can clip offers and pay, but I can't shop because any product searches show an error page. With the app installed it deep links to the app if I try to search target online and click a link, which again provides an error page and makes it impossible to shop target while mobile.

This app is terrible. What's the point of offering "drive up" or delivery when you don't even list your inventory? What's the point of this app when I'm going to have to go in and find what I need anyway??! Makes no sense! And then you have to get CREATIVE when you look up something up, otherwise it won't pop up. EXAMPLE: when I type Suja NOTHING pops up but when I look for juice, it pops up with the list. DUMB!! Kombucha doesn't even show but when I go inside there it is! DUMB AF!

When I try to save an exact item, the app will save the entire collection the item belongs to. This is very irritating and makes it harder to find the item when I'm ready to purchase it. Also, I tried to leave feedback about this on the app, but it blocked my view of what I was writing, and the keyboard I couldn't dismiss blocked the submit button.

*UPDATE Dec. 9th* It's frustrating to have to swipe the entire screen to move to another image of an item I'm looking at. If I don't perfectly swipe right to left from the edge of the screen to the other edge of the screen, it reverts back. ----------------------------- Outside of a few pricing issues and one ordering problem in the last few years, this is one of the best shopping apps I've ever experienced. the weekly ad and sales are typically updated very regularly. And promptly I might add.

Such poor design. Swiping through item pictures is very finicky, you have to make an exact perfect overly-long gesture or you just swipe your finger over and over to no avail. Also, when you're choosing substitute items, you can't see if they are low stock. Makes it a little tricky to know what to pick as a backup, doesn't it? These have been issues for at least the couple years I've been using the app. You'll notice all our complaints are completely ignored, because they don't care.

The app is strange. You do save a little, mostly from online deals, and it's great for pickups. However free shipping after $35 isn't a guarantee and there's no transparency to understand why you're getting charged for shipping. I've also noticed that questions I've made about products are rarely answered and end up being removed from a product's page. Also negative reviews, even when I'm a verified buyer, have been taken down. Makes me extremely distrustful of ratings and of Target's integrity.

Can't connect if you use a VPN. I use Mozilla VPN on my device, and the target app get stuck at the login screen, looping an error message. As soon as I turn off the VPN, it works again. I can see why licensing deals require services like Hulu or Netflix to block vpns, but why on earth does target? It's an annoying design, and it took a while to discover what the problem was. They never responded to emails at the address listed here. The app doesn't seem to be a priority for Target.

Needed to get essentials while sick so I thought it'd be the perfect time to try the drive up function to avoid coming into contact with strangers and staff. Turns out you have to use the app for this so went ahead and downloaded it. This took far longer to search through and find my items than being able to use my laptop/keyboard. Tried to place my order, but after some time it was canceled for "technical issues", but gave no notification. Two more attempts and I gave up. Major waste of time

I usually use the app multiple times a month to place an order, at minimum, and multiple times per week to search for items/add them to my cart. For the last two weeks, any item I try to add, it says unable to add for pickup. I chatted with tech support, and they don't know what the problem is. Definitely missing being able to put a quick order in, instead of having to go to the next town to the dreaded WM.

last couple of weeks, my app has not been working correctly. it will show me ads, deal of the day, all of the widgets and pictures, but if I try to actually shop from the list of items, I get an error screen saying "an error occured during search." If I scan an item in store or click through directly to the item listing page, it will have pickup and delivery grayed out and only have shipping available despite an item being physically in the store and received as inventory.

Order pickup/drive up is soooo finicky. I highly recommend to just go to the store instead of setting pick up orders, as there is a 95% chance the items you order for pickup will suddenly be unavailable, or out of stock the moment after you complete your order. Target is a great store, but it'd be so much better if their order pickup services were on Bed, Bath, and Beyond or Amazon Fresh level. 😞 I strongly do not recommend order pickup/drive up from Target. Just go in!!

No major complaints with the app. It's generally easy to navigate but I wish there was an easier way to find and apply coupons? It's a tab but there is so many to scroll from which can get hectic.The discover tab is so hectic When you order stuff for drive up generally little mistakes but books and media may get mixed up. However target will refund you if the wrong item is given (and you keep it). It's happened a few times for books so I won't be buying books as often online.

I love the store and the products better than Walmart but Walmart has the better app. The apps are how I shop now. I tried to contact customer service for pricing issues but that didn't even work. Nothing would load FAQ wouldn't load. 4.99 when purchased online at check out though it's 9.49. I have purchased this item before and no issues. The brightness is horrible. We can't control that. blinded trying to look at my receipt in the Blinded with order# screen for pick up order. Not cool

App can be glitch especially when in a store. I don't like that sometimes I scan an item & doesn't give price & instead of hitting "x" to retry, you have to start over again. Also, when checking out you can't just check out shipping items. You can check out store stuff individually. Stupid. Also, sometimes you can't narrow down your search with guest rating.

Does the developer care about this app or target's online experience at all???? Glitchy. Unavailable items always come up searches. The items are not meant to be restocked and they make searching cumbersome. Saving an item to your favorites and coming back to see an entire collection saved and having to search for the item you wanted is ridiculous. I have forgotten about the item often andd removed the entire collection.

This app is so buggy perpetually. For one, PayPal never works, for two, the scrolling left and right on images in app is soooo sensitive. If you go slightly up or down while swiping right or left on a photo, the app scrolls vertically and cancels the horizontal scroll. So annoying because I want to see the photos posted! I want to pay with PayPal! I find myself loathing when I have to shop from Target now.

Little frustrating. I buy items, and there are no coupons or discounts. I go in the next day and what do you know? Coupons for the exact item I bought. I went back to cs, and they said they couldn't adjust the price because the coupon was AFTER I bought the item. The target policy is 7 days to get an adjustment, and they don't honor it. App shows item in stock and I get the message it's not in stock. No option to communicate while they are shopping like the instacart people do.

Worthless. So many items in stores are not priced or have a different online price. I'd guess at least 80% of the time when you pick up an item and scan it it says item not available at this location. I'm literally holding it in my hand and scanning it. Also it's worthless to look up items to plan your trip. It will show that items arent in stock, but plenty of times I find it on the shelf. Also says things are in stock, but they aren't. Understandably there's loss and ppl having items in cart

There are now two icons appearing- one with a wallet shortcut, one without; but they both open the same app. There is only ONE Target app installed but TWO icons for it. Can't remove just one. --- With the new update, a delivery fee is added to my order even though it's set for curbside. Often the buttons disappear when trying to add an item to my cart... I have to check other stores but select my current store, then the buttons appear where they should be and I can add it to my cart.

Would rather shop on the webpage but the webpage isn't working. Tech support for the webpage is totally useless. I would rather have a wide screen to shop with than scrolling on my phone. Also, another thing that is super annoying now, you put in what you want in the search engine and it gives you a whole list of stuff you are NOT looking for and you have to go through a bunch of junk just to find what you're wanting to buy. It's a waste of time.

I've had the app on my phone, and as of yesterday, there's now two icons showing! I have no idea why it showed up that way, so I thought I could delete one of them, but when I did, both disappeared! I tried downloading the app again, and two icons appeared again! This app sux on my Android, but no issues on my iPhone!

I had no issues with the previous version. However since I updated to the latest version, the Search function is terrible. It hardly ever returns any results for the item/product I'm looking for. It is very difficult to purchase if I can't find anything. Strongly recommend fixing this 'glitch' ASAP. Thanks

First, I am unable to use the pickup and drive up feature when I was able to weeks ago. My store still has this available at the location. Additionally, it seems to be forcing me to use same day deliver and I do not want to. The app has server issues consistently. It makes you refresh every ti.e you click on your cart or remove items. Last, At one point within the last week there were two apps showing up. That has since gone away. But there is consistent bugs with this app. Not a happy customer.

I hate that there's only one type of notification. I like the app other than that. I don't want the ads. I do want to know when my order is ready. They should be different categories if notifications that I can turn on or off. Get with it, Target. Two entire stars off for this oversight, which must be intentional in this day and age.

It is so insanely frustrating trying to swipe left and right between product photos in this app that it caused me to lose my mind and actually bother to write this review. You've got to swipe nearly the full width of your phone or the image will snap back to the previous photo and you'd better hope you're not a little off axis or you'll just be scrolling up or down the listing itself instead. I'm going to go pull my hair out now. The app is fine otherwise. The store's good too.

I have not been able to use the app for months I've refreshed, logged out, uninstalled and installed. Every time I try to search for something EVERY TIME I TRY TO SEARCH it freezes and says "An error occurred during your search" FOR MONTHS. FOR MONTHS. It's so broken I end up shopping at Amazon or some other retailer because I can't find anything to add to my cart. So annoying

The biggest flaw with the app is it encourages everything to be mailed. I should be able to get the same prices I see on the app at the store drive up but they will have a slightly different item (packaging) to prevent being able to price match on the app. If I walk into the store they'll price match their online price with in store merchandise. Making the app only useful if you go into the store defeating the purpose of having an app in the first place.

EDIT: I have officially given up on this app. It's even worse now. I got a filtered list of 60 or so hits when searching for a vanity, and literally EVERY SINGLE ONE is 'unavailable'. Not in-store, for pickup, or for shipping. What is the point? Always shows things that are out of stock, even when settings indicate it shouldn't. It's also odd to have to toggle 'pickup', 'shipping', and 'delivery' options in seemingly multiple different ways. It's clunky and frustrating.

Normally I love the Target app, but for at least the last 6 months you guys have a consistent issue with paying with the EBT card. It constantly goes to the point to enter your pin, and then it just cycles round and round and never moves on. I've deleted everything, and gone over to Safeway to do my order countless times now. You're loosing out. For at least the last 4 weeks we can't get the app to work for EBT at all, and done 6 different purchases at Safeway instead.

Works, until it doesn't. The search function is not ideal; when I search for an item at least 10 unrelated items pop up. Sometimes I'll see "8 in stock at (location)", and I'll go to the store to find out the shelf is empty. Or, the search will indicate an item is "$3.99 at (location)", then when I click I see "no longer sold at (location)"! Why do you do this????

The app is great, except the manage Red Card section is broken, and keeps locking up. It's disappointing that they don't fix this so people can reliable check their balance for their store card. Besides that, it's the best app I've used for shopping at stores. You can scan items, find what's in stock, and it makes checking out effortless, you just scan your in-app barcode, and select pay with wallet, and you get a receipt. A perfect example of the ideal store app.

love this app. love how easy it is to find what I'm looking for. The only thing I Hate about Target, is their pick up system. when given the option to order and pick up at the store between 4-7 business days, it can easlyvget lost. I've had 4 items lost and had to pre-order or order something else from another store. Maybe I think this is horrible le because I'm used to Amazon Prime delivery and pick up. Anyway, the only complaint I have about Target is their pick up at the store system!

Can't use app because wants me to choose a store but can't find the store I have been using for 2 years. Epic fail. Maybe the best retail app out there. Easily handles online, in store and pickup, has a shopping list and a store map. Favorites , sales, Target Circle deals. Lots of good. Only thing that could be improved is to sort the shopping list by aisle.

While the shopping and checkout experiences were smooth and easy, the app doesn't allow to change the store when an item in your order is not available/out-of-stock, after having placed your order and paid. Looks like changing to free delivery is an option, but I would like my item the same day as the rest of them. Please fix. Thank you!

Exceptional app, easy to use. Easy to price shop, pick up, locate items when shopping in store. I have become a loyal Target customer for home and grocery (packaged items). I wish they would add a notification feature when out of stock items are back in stock in my closest Target. That would encourage more brand loyalty. Currently, I get frustrated and am forced to make an additional trip to a different store which has the item, probably a non-Target one.

I have been using the app for years and have loved it. With the latest update, I can't do anything. Every item I click on says "there was an error loading product details". It especially is annoying because since COVID I've been using the drive up option for groceries and can no longer do that, so I've had to go to other stores that offer drive up services.

What ever the update was, it has interfered with bring able 2 view pictures of items when clicked on. I had items in my favorites and when clicked on them I get a viewing error. I can't add to my cart from my favorites! I even unintalled & reinstalled the app., got same thing! It says was updated on 8/10, it was working fine prior to the update! There is no number for conflict resolution.

App is difficult to navigate and manage a cart (versus a shopping list) for a particular store. Reason for two of five stars. Once an order for drive-up is confirmed, the process works beautifully in the real world--contactless order gets dropped in the trunk of my car and my bar code is scanned through a closed window--sweet!! :-) Placing an order via the app is aggravating, however...

This app is just OK. It keeps crashing, restarting, and isn't very intuitive. The search isn't great either. On the other hand, the inventory numbers and in store items location are always on point and the information is updated almost immediately. Returns are also simple if you purchase through the app and the streamlining of paying with multiple fund sources (ie. Gift card+circle points+bank card) for the same transaction is also a plus.

None of the products will load when you click them. This is a new issue, I've never had problems with the app before. Each time I click a product (any product), I get an error stating "there was an error loading product details, please try again". Closing the app and reopening, restarting my phone, and uninstalling and reinstalling didn't work.

Items show as in stock and available to ship but no button to add to cart. App constantly acts up in various ways, its something different each time. Slows down till it freezes and closes. Wish it had the option to click on "shop all (enter brand name here)" as it does on the web version when looking an item from that line. But the app wallet barcode is extremely easy for making returns without receipts,and order pick ups are awesome so thank you for that!

Love Target! However 2 big flaws in their app is (1) it's hard to filter your searches and (2) reviews are impossible to do on your phone. I just tried looking at home decor sales and can't see an option to filter results on my Motorola phone. I don't see an option to even submit a review thru my phone and can never view others review photos with my phone.

I really appreciate the work Target and it's employees are doing during this crazy time. Something that would make the app MUCH better, in my opinion, is to be able to select "pick up curbside" once, and have it apply to the whole order. Also, it would be great to be able to filter for "available for pickup" and "in stock in store I've designated." It's frustrating to be putting to gather a pickup order and then see things that aren't eligible for pick up. Perhaps they could be greyed out? TY!

The Target app is not user friendly. It uses bait and switch tactics, shows inacuracte information and deals, does now show proper in-store inventory availability, and contacting customer service is impossible. Making an order online or through the app has led to delay after delay, double charges, lost returns, and endless runarounds. Just go to the shop in person. Don't bother with this useless app. Even the coupons don't work half the time and the in store attendants just shrug.

This was my first time using the app for shopping at Target and I am really pleased with how easy this part of it has been. My disappointment is that so many of the products I needed were not available for drive-up, only in-store pick up; it seems whether or not items(specifically grocery and personal care items) can be delivered to your car varies from Target to Target.

Difficult to change stores when searching. Kept returning to original store despite change stores. Was told that an item was 'in stock' at another store, drove to that store to be told they had zero on shelf and zero in backstock, but were showing an inventory of 2. I understand how hard it is to get an exact count, but a low inventory warning would be helpful. App has progressed from the early days, but still has usability issues.

In recent years, Due to health related problems it has become increasingly difficult at times to concentrate, focus, comprehend, etc. Which is why thus far I hadn't tried the app. Very much to my surprise, This has been a great experience for me when it came to understanding the app, searching for items, finding additional discounts/savings (when available), and then the checkout procedure. So if anyone is having any doubting thoughts about trying this app, Please try it, I highly recommend it!!

Fairly good shopping experience, for online shopping and (with stock availability and aisle location) for in-store shopping. App navigation can be messy, but it's well compensated by the wide variety of items for purchase and tons of features (shopping lists, coupons/promotions, rewards program, etc) for happier shopping. Prices are reasonable but not usually lowest. Easy to choose between shipping and in-store or curbside pickup but may be confusing for those not used to online shopping.

The Target drive-up is super convenient and I've had great interactions with staff 90% of the time. However, my challenge with the drive-up service is centered around available alternative options when something I ordered is unavailable. The product just ends up being cancelled because it's not available but there is no option to replace with something else, which leads me to shop elsewhere due to the amount of times I was unable to have my complete order fulfilled.

Was surprised how quickly everything came in. The app is easy to use, very easy to check the status of ur orders. I bumped it down to 3 instead of 4 stars because as convenient as it is to have multiple delivery options... It's not convenient when I go to checkout and have to either delete items or pay/choose multiple delivery methods. Also, yrs ago when I first used targetapp it was bc they had GREAT coupon app. This isn't it. And I don't wanna download other apps. I NEVER get any savings.

Good 4 drive up. Circle used to have better coupons but now few, if any, of the things I use have a circle deal. When looking thru circle deals, if you click on a deal for details when you try to go back to the list of deals you have to start all over at the beginning instead of going back to where you left off. Very frustrating. App freezes a lot & is slow. Please add a "re-order" button. I usually go thru my last few purchase lists & reorder a lot of things but it takes too many clicks.

It would make sense that I should be able to select my shopping method (curbside, in-store pickup or delivery) at the start of my order and not have to select the method with each item. Also if I'm shopping for in-store or curbside, I only want to see items available in the store. It's simple and provides for a less annoying shopping experience. :)

This version works a lot better than previous ones. It is possible to scan products at the store faster. The barcode focus works better as well. Some products are still not found, which I find odd because I am at the store with the product in my hand and the scanner there finds the product. Selecting the store you're at, you can find a product on the app and it will tell you in what aisle it is stocked (most of the time). For payment this the virtual wallet it is not yet well managed.

App is required for curbside pickup but notifications rely on email. Links to email aren't joined to app. Inventory data on app is unreliable. Notifications to email for unavailable products came too late. Can't select alternate product. Can't search nearby stores' inventory. Doesn't identify the closest stores to my location. Can't limit searches to things that are actually in the store. Search floods the returned list with garbage unrelated to search term. Hard to cancel order in app.

I can't believe I just placed a mobile order without wanting to stab somebody. Really good job on the UX. Only thing I would improve is the icons at the bottom. As a new user I wasn't sure what they were by looking. Also wish the Add to List function didn't require scrolling, and that it would add all items to cart with the shipping/pickup method you chose at the start of the session. Other than that, I didn't actually mind placing a large order via app. Usually I have to go to desktop.

Nightmare of all nightmares. This time each item I ordered the app would then freeze and I would have to close out the app and go back in. Each time !!!!! 1 hour 42 minutes to order 9 items. My last order was even worse with almost 3 hours to order four items with constant constant freezing of the app. And be prepared they don't allow curbside for about 3/4 of their items including any items to help protect you from the pandemic. They want high-risk persons to walk into their store to buy items.

Slow - froze & force closed a lot. I don't like that if I search for "dog", then "gifts" it just lists 356 items that have toys, treats and food mixed together when I just want to look at the toys. I'd also like to set the preferences at the beginning to indicate that for everything I put in my cart I will pick up, ship, delivery, drive up rather than have to make a choice for every item.

Very good 1st time experience. A little confused regarding how to get to my cart. Using that selection from the drop down menu (accessed with the 3 dots in the upper right corner) did not work...didn't seem to do anything. Now that I know to just arrow back until I get there, all is well. I did have double the items wanted. Did selecting cart in drop down menu add more? Selecting form of pick-up/delivery & which store couldn't be easier. I did product research on desktop-no reflection on app.

I really like the app, and use it pretty much every time I shop at Target! A few suggestions: - for DriveUp: if I didn't have to hit the 'back' button to look for a new item in the search bar every time, that would be helpful. it would also be cool if the drive up feature was made available online via PC - there were a few items that weren't drive up eligible - the list of eligible items could be expanded to include more frozen, refrigerated and fresh items

This is the most frustrating shopping app ever! It is slow and constantly freezes or closes on it's own. To check out I have to try several times because when I select my payment method it kicks me back to the home page. So annoying. Makes me not want to buy from target. I would rather do Wal-Mart pick up at this point. Don't waste your time with this app! Save your sanity and order elsewhere.

It does have annoyances - search can be wonky, the Favorites list crashes when you get to the bottom, the Favorites list doesn't show the format I actually favorited (current problems). However, being able to search for everything Target carries and seeing whether my store has it and where; ordering for pickup (or delivery); seeing deals; saving my favorites and seeing what I've ordered before - and scanning the app to pay and get coupons is great. Not perfect but great overall

"An unexpected error occurred..." every time I tried to do anything in the app. I had to try five times to set my password. Similar experience with adding things to the cart. I had to edit my cart and I again got the "an unexpected error occurred" message. Same thing when I tried to pay. I wouldn't bother, but this crappy app is the only way to order for curbside pickup at Target. Our regional grocery store had online ordering with curbside pick up down pat back in March. Target can do better.

App is unusable now. It constantly asks for my "go-to Target", and forces you to enter a city or zip code. But as soon as you enter 3 letters/digits, it gives an error message of "Failed to lookup a place for your input. Please try again." There is no way out of this ridiculous prompt, as I have already set my local Target store to be my preferred store a long time ago. Clearing the app cache and data does nothing to help, and neither does uninstalling to reinstall the app do anything to help.

has me log in but then keeps glitching and won't keep it on one page. had the app over 2 yrs with no issue. tried uninstalling and re installing, SAME THING. I never signed out to begin with and now all of a sudden it boots me off and just keeps doing it every 3 seconds. poorly made. and no its not my phone OR my service. every other app works just fine!

This would work so much better if I could start with choosing my method of delivery (drive-up) instead of having to choose it on every ordered item. Then, when searching for items, show me what you have available for drive-up. If it's not available, show me what is. If my package of whatever is not available, show me anything similar! This would solve a lot of time and frustration.

Great shopping app. I don't have to preselecte my items, I can just shop for what I want, scan for deals and go. I can scan for a price and even if it's at a different store. I can set up shopping lists and a favorite list. I've even ordered from home for pick up and delivery all frim the app. Really like that app. And no ads!! No ads, no annoying suggestions.

UPDATE 7/23/20: App seems to be running a little more smoothly. Also, they added an action where you can choose Drive Up BEFORE you go and add a bunch of items to your cart. So it shows what is available for Drive Up! No "continue shopping" button when you first check your cart. Still fairly easy and simple to guide. 1. Not very clear. 2. Says item is available when it is not. 3. Add a bunch of items and then it tells you "Not available for Drive up". 4. Fairly easy and simple to use.

Spent hours trying to load cart in the app for drive up service.Suddenly app would kick items into in-store pickup and I would have to manually re-enter each item one by one. App only allows drive up orders to be placed in the app. Takes a long time to type or dictate each item one at a time into app. App does not allow multiple of one item unless you go to the cart to add. I will shop elsewhere for curbside service and maybe use Target to ship some items. Frustrating and time consuming.

Annoying in so many ways. 1) During this epidemic, you have to use the app to schedule pickup. You can no longer use the website, arrange the order, then use the app when you get to the pickup. If you would prefer the larger web interface to better manage your pickup shopping, you are just out of luck. 2) Items listed as available on the app are NOT necessarily available in store -- even if the app says it is. Every order I've done has had 3-10 items that are NOT in the store. And you don't find that out until 4 hours later when they are done "processing." If that item was important for pickup, you have to make other arrangements elsewhere. They do not notify you that an item is missing as they are "processing" it so that you can ask for alternatives. 3) If there's an error with the order, they don't tell you what has caused it. It's just a general error. You have to remove items until the order goes through. 4) There is no option for picking alternatives in case an item is out of stock. NONE. Again, you won't find out for 4 hours. You will not be contacted or notified if you would like a replacement. Unlike every other pickup at store app I use (instacart, kroger).

Love the target app, always score good deals and is easy to use. Love that you can scan stuff at the store and you can see if there are any discounts. NEW REVIEW Sadly my app has been useless for the past week or so, I cannot look at items i want to see. It always says there's an error loading. I have turned my phone on and off, Uninstalled the app, signed out but nothing works. PLEASE fix this.

This is an okay app. The downside is that if you decide to switch delivery methods (or fail to choose the wrong one while putting your cart together), the process is time intensive. There's no option to either select all the items and switch delivery or switch delivery methods at the top of your list. Very annoying. Maybe you should work on making the app more customer friendly.

Shopping cart no longer working. "Error loading product details" on every single item. I'm not sure what's going on but I've been ordering from Target app a few times a week because my whole household had COVID. I've uninstalled and reinstalled, rebooted my phone, cleared cache/cookies, checked for updates. None of this worked. I had to order from Walmart instead.

I've used the app twice and generally like it. two things for Target to work on: #1 test all the links work. Both times I've used the app, I've clicked on products and then get the message the product details can't load. Today, 3/4/19, this occurred with organic white queen size sheets (which were a sales item). There isn't even a report an issue or option to purchase them. #2 Once I select instore pick up, that should be my default for all items in my cart (you need to click each item again)

They fixed it! I've used the app more and more the last few months. A problem popped up recently that prevented the viewing of item details which also prevented drive up shopping. The issue has now been fixed. I love the convenience of using drive up or pick up. The app allows me to search for, compare items, select, and purchase from home. The shopping list allows me to store info for frequent purchases. I love it.

I used to do alot more online shopping with target, but both their website and app have changed their filtering. making it annoying and difficult to shop with. instead of normal filtering on the app, you get thousands/hundreds of results. not to mention not being able to log in to manage my redcard and make payments. i havent been able to log in for a couple of months and pay my bill without the hassle of calling customer service, to which i only get a temporary fix. fustrating to say the least.
data.replyText: Hi Valeria - Using the Target app should be quick and easy. We appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts about the filtering system in the app. We'll keep working to make improvements with each new app release. Please keep checking back. - Julie

data.text: This app used to be 1 of my most used apps but for the past month I can't get any products to load! Just get an "error loading product details" message. Even after reinstalling several times! I use Target pick up as my main form of shopping these days, now I can't even add anything to my cart for a purchase! Hopefully I'm not the only 1 with this problem, so it can be fixed quickly. Guess I'll have to resort to Amazon or Walmart (sigh) for my big box purchases. 🤷🏼‍♀️

This app is average. Yes it works, but everything is a chore. Updating quantities should be fast, and allow me to set quantities before I can add to my cart. Pages handle filters differently, so I never know if it's available for shipping, delivery, or in-stock locally. And there are unexplained delays when navigating around the app, this should be faster than shopping on the website. Checkout is the one streamlined bright spot. Just simplify the app.

It's pretty easy to use. I do think the promos, like the $10 off an order when using pick up/drive up/same day ship needs to have the fine print immediately listed. You currently have to click on one of the promo choices (pick up, drive up, etc.) then click on the link down at the bottom of the page that takes you out of the app & to the internet to read the fine print restrictions.

Quick to look something up, or check out if an item in store has a different color/size. It has performance issues. App crashes a few times if I leave the app and try and come back. Often unclear UX. I dislike the payment forms the most, and the card scanning function really should error out at some point instead of leading me to believe I might be able to get my card to scan. Overall, super promising app! Needs some work. I'll update my review when I see some improvements!! (Samsung Galaxy S9)

While I have been using this for years, by necessity, it has always had issues. Occasionally the issues are major. The worst is that, when you tell it to remember your device, it NEVER actually does (not on Android, at least), thus forcing you to get a security email passcode everytime you want to look at your Red card account. Worse still, every once in a while, the passcode email just will not send. It claims it does, but it never actually arrives.

I would love to see the pick-up option through the actual website and not limited to the app. The other frustration is the limited options for what is available for pick-up i.e. nothing frozen, no fruit, no refrigerated items. The great thing about Target is the ability to get all my groceries, produce and other items in one place, but the curb side pick-up limited options makes the Walmart drive-up a better option since you can add all those items. If Target wants to get in on the game of pick-up, make it equal to or better than all the competitors (Whole Foods, Walmart, Kroger, etc) otherwise it's a not really saving time since I still have to go inside, or somewhere else, for all my produce, frozen and refrigerated items.
data.replyText: Hi Lindsy - Great suggestion for the website! It will definitely be passed to our developers. We also appreciate your comments about item availability for drive up. You may want to take a look at our Shipt partners for those items. You're feedback does help us improve the shopping experience for all Target guests. Thanks! - Julie

data.text: Why can't we zoom photos any longer? Such an important feature when shopping, to see textures, small patterns, colors, print on packaging. I can't imagine why you would have that capability and then disable it. PLEASE bring it back. Most other tasks and capabilities in the app are great--simplifies shopping and ordering. Search function could use a little work.

Very difficult to update CC info. Wouldn't scan my card or accept manual entry. I checked my work several times and it was correct. But it showed an exclamation mark indicating unacceptable entry. Finally used PayPal. Then it made me reenter my shipping address. A TOTALLY UNNECESSARY NUISANCE! SUPER FRUSTRATING EXPERIENCE!! Plus, I place the exact same order 1-2X/mo. It would be nice if I could see my history and repeat the order. Lots of other apps have that feature.

This app is currently unusable. I was about to do a drive up order, had my cart ready and everything. I went back into the app so the drive up has time and it went straight into the "find my store" prompt and I couldn't get out of it. Even when I tried to do it again (several tries), an error message would pop up before I could even complete the zip code input. It's very frustrating and it's the second time it happened. This time I cleared cache, uninstalled and reinstalled and nothing works.

This is the worst shopping app I have ever used. Fixes needed: do not make me click on type of pick up or shipping on each and every of my 32 items. There should be option to pick 1 type as a default for all. Second, I added Freebox promo code, which can't ship to my address. I do all my shopping on line, even Walmart ships to my address. Complete scam of free items. I called customer service and it took her 30+ minutes to figure it out. She was great, but 30 minutes?
